I’m learning to become a full-stack web developer.

I’m a Chemical Engineer working in the oil & gas industry who specialises in safety-critical engineered systems.
I’m learning to code in my free time, and am building up a porfolio of personal projects.

About Me

Hello! My name is Colin and I’m learning to code.
As an engineer through and through, I love to build and design things! My interest in coding started in 2005 when I decided to try my hand at making a Flash game back when <ActionScript 2.0> was still around!
(Note: Flash support is no longer available with most browsers so your mileage may vary with the above link.)

Fast-forward to today, and I’ve spent 4 years at a large corporation straight out of university working as a Chemical / Process Engineer in the oil & gas industry. During this time, I found myself gravitating back to my interest in coding.

My main focus these days is to build up a portfolio of different coding projects to show that I’ve still got the chops to go down a different career path.

Here are a few technologies I’ve been working with recently:

  • Python
  • HTML5
  • CSS3
  • ReactJS
  • React Redux
  • SQL

Other technologies that I’ve worked with quite often which are less related to web development include:

  • VBA
  • MATLAB
  • PowerBI DAX
  • PowerQuery M

Work Experience

I'm currently working as a Chemical / Process Engineer in the oil & gas industry. Although I have not dont any coding in a tech-related environment, I frequently use my knowledge of OLE Automations in Windows to make my job easier.

I hope to move into the tech industry in the near future!
